greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the second term in the simple continued fraction of Pi^n.
link: Eric M. Schmidt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) \p 2000 a(n) = floor(1/(Pi^n - floor(Pi^n))); for(i=1,100,print1(a(i),",")) \\ _Vim Wenders_, Mar 28 2008
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Mar 14 2008
